titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the H.C. Yetter's Hotel register 1978.116
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:35 +0000.

did.abstract: Register of H.C. Yetter's Hotel in Greenport, Long Island, N.Y., operated by proprietor Henry C. Yetter. The register lists the names of guests and entertainers staying at the hotel for the period 1891 to 1895, and includes each guest's signature, address and place of residence, room number, and date and time of arrival. The last several pages of the register contain children's drawings dating from 1909.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); H.C. Yetter's Hotel register, 1978.116, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.
